meanings.definition: A stretch of swampy or boggy ground.
meanings.sent1: The explorer carefully navigated the mires in search of rare plants.
meanings.sent2: The mires were home to many unique species of insects.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the mires were a magical kingdom full of hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: The mires whispered secrets of ancient times to those who dared to listen.
meanings.sent5: The smell of decay hung heavy in the mires, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To involve or entangle in difficulties or complications.
meanings.sent1: She felt mired in a web of lies and deceit.
meanings.sent2: The project became mired in delays and budget issues.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to explain only mired the situation further.
meanings.sent4: The political scandal mired the reputation of the entire government.
meanings.sent5: The detective's investigation was mired by conflicting witness statements.

meanings.definition: To cause to become stuck in mud or wet ground.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain mires the wheels of the car in the muddy road.
meanings.sent2: The hiker got mired in the swamp and needed help to get out.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy mires itself in the wet grass while playing.
meanings.sent4: The tractor mires down in the soft soil, unable to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The careless traveler mires their boots in the thick mud, struggling to walk.
